item.title: Michael add a quote by John Maynard Keynes
item.description: "The long run is a misleading guide to current affairs. In the long run we are all dead." -- John Maynard Keynes

item.title: Michael add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "A kind Providence furnishes the limpest personality with a little gum or starch in the form of tradition." -- George Eliot

item.title: Michael add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Elinor agreed with it all, for she did not think he deserved the compliment of rational opposition." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Michael add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Michael add a quote by Ralph Ellison
item.description: "Life is to be lived, not controlled; and humanity is won by continuing to play in face of certain defeat." -- Ralph Ellison

item.title: Michael add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Michael add a quote by William Thackeray
item.description: "He was always thinking of his brother's soul, or of the souls of those who differed with him in opinion: it is a sort of comfort which many of the serious give themselves." -- William Thackeray

item.title: Michael add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "I live so resolutely apart from physical contingencies that my senses no longer trouble to inform me of them." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Michael add a quote by Mike Tyson
item.description: "Everybody has a plan until they get punched in the face." -- Mike Tyson
